mods.abstract: $25 REWARD. Runaway from the subscriber, about the 1st of November, the negro man DANIEL. He sometimes calls himself WILLIAM. Said negro si 18 or 20 years old, no beard, has a scar on the left side of his chin, being occasioned, as he says, by a burn when young. He is about 5 feet 10 or 11 inches high, very well proportioned, and of black color. He may have traders' clothes on, or along with him, as he has been but recently purchased from W. C. Adams, of New Orleans. Twenty-five dollars will be paid for his delivery to me, or in any jail where I can get him. JAMES R. DEVALL. nov 24-ts
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )

detail.title: Sugar planter. : (West Baton Rouge [i.e. Port Allen, West Baton Rouge Parish, La.]) 1856-1925

mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
